items.details: Upcoming Tests Grammar Workshop - Unit 2 - NOUNS (L9-14) - Thursday, Nov 13th Reading The definition Paper is for TOMORROW The story this week is 'Weird Friends." Please watch the video until you understand the story. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZdYQdzhaurc The spelling test is on Friday! predators protection immune species emerges cluster sea anemone tentacles rhino egret blind antennae detect flee pod Extra reading ( I have added some new stories) TO IMPROVE READING AND EMBED LEARNING, YOU SHOULD BE LOGGING INTO READWORKS Please go to ReadWorks and complete some of the stories assigned. They will help you with your work in school and also improve your overall reading. Go to www.readworks.org/student Enter our class code YU6GQ2 Your password is 1234 unless you already changed it Math Good Job on the test today! Only Khan Academy tonight Please have your child practice a little Khan Academy math each night at https://www.khanacademy.org/join/VK6QDS9E to help strengthen their skills. Korean (MONDAY) Pages 154-159 Social Studies World Heritage Day – Ireland Project Reminder Please make sure you are working on your World Heritage Day – Ireland project. Discuss with your group and start generating fun and exciting ideas for your booth. Your booth should have: Something to teach (1–2 minutes) An activity visitors can try (3–4 minutes) Pictures and decorations – write, draw, or color, using green, white, and orange Team balance – make sure everyone in your group contributes fairly. Some students are going home and spending hours preparing, while others need to try harder. Think about how you can add value, make your group better, and make it more fun for everyone. Individual and group grades – the work you do for the board and activity will be graded individually, and how you interact with other students during World Heritage Day will also be part of your grade. Think carefully about your ideas and come to class ready to share them. Be creative and make your booth fun and engaging for everyone who visits the Ireland show room. Reminder: If you plan to send a food donation, please send the letter by November 13th. Science (TOMORROW) For homework, you need to complete the blank climate chart for the city Mr. Smith assigned today. Instructions: Go online (for example, https://en.climate-data.org/) and find: The average temperature (°C) for each month The average precipitation (mm) for each month On your chart: Draw a line graph for temperature Draw a bar chart for precipitation Use different colors for the line and bars to make it bright and clear Label your axes and give your chart a title: “Climate of [City Name]” Be creative — we will display your graphs in class Remember: Check your data carefully for each month and do your best Language Arts Grammar Workshop 70-71 Vocabulary Workshop 66-67
